intro: Hypogon anisatus, commonly known as the hairy nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive hairy foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the evening. The plant produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals, containing alkaloids such as solanine. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in woodland edges or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and potentially hazardous.
